Name: Marmesin
Description: (+)-marmesin is a marmesin. It is an enantiomer of a nodakenetin.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) Kim EJ et al; J Agric Food Chem 59: 8806-15 (2011) (2) Uwaifo AO; J Toxicol Environ Health 13: 521-30 (1984) (3) Znati M et al; Molecules 19: 16959-75 (2014) (4) Chavarria M et al; Rev Biol Trop 56: 1043-51 (2008) (5) Deng GG et al; Zhongguo Zhong Yao Za Zhi 40: 2148-56 (2015) (6) Kim JS et al; Arch Pharm Res 29: 617-23 (2006) (7) Luu YY et al; Zhongguo Zhong Yao Za Zhi 31: 667-8 (2006) (8) Chen LW et al; Chem Biodivers 7: 1814-21 (2010) (9) Jang DS et al; J Nat Prod 66: 1166-70 (2003) (10) Laguna A; Planta Med 50: 112 (1984)
plant_concentrations.Value: Marmesin was detected in oriental herbal plant Dang Gui (Angelica gigas) harvested from three regions of Korea(1). Marmesin was found in three Nigerian medicinal plants: Afraegle paniculata, Clausena anisata and Azadirachta indica(2). Marmesin was detected in Ferula lutea flowers collected form the region of Beja, Tunisia in Apr 2010(3). Amyris brenseii, collected from Grecia, Costa Rica contained marmesin(4). Marmesin was found in the roots of Angelica dahurica var. formosana cv. Chuanbaizhi(5), Dystaenia takeshimana(6), Heracleum rapula(7) and Ficus nervosa(8). Marmesin was detected in the stem of Tephrosia toxicaria(9) and leaves of Amyris diatripa(10). [
